item.description:
Level 2 paddle open to Sea Kayaks and Rec Kayaks 10ft or longer which contain bulkheads.

We'll paddle the inner harbor on the Seabrook Side then return to the put-in around 8pm. For those who would like to head out again to watch the Fireworks we'll depart again at around 8:30pm and paddle across the Harbor to watch the Fireworks from the inner harbor.

If you plan to paddle after dark to view the fireworks you'll need a boat light on a pole which is white a light that is viewable from 360 degrees and mounted to your kayak. Another option is mounting the light on your PFD but it must be viewable from 360 degrees. These lights are available from most kayak shops as well as boating or sporting goods stores that sell kayaks.

Park in the large public lot next to Eastman's Fish Market "where Seacoast Kayak shop was".

From the North: Take Rte. 95 South to Exit 2 "Exeter/Hampton Route 101". Go through toll, then follow signs for Hampton-Route 101 East. Take this to Hampton Beach. Take a right onto Rte. 1A heading South. Go over the bridge. Parking lot is 1/2 mile down on the right.

From the South: Take Rte. 495 North to 95 North. Take Exit 60-Rte. 286 Salisbury Beaches. Follow Rte. 286 East to its end at the beach. At the lights, take a left onto Rte 1A North. Go
1 mile and through the next set of lights. Parking lot is down on the left.

Life vests aka PFDs must be worn at all times when paddling with this group.

Click Here for Google Maps Directions: Parking is next to Eastman's Fish Markrt/previously Seacoast Kayak shop
item.name: Seabrook/Hampton Harbor Paddle - Optional Fireworks Paddle later
